ITEM 1. BUSINESS.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART I - ITEM 1. BUSINESS section of TSLA's financial report, formatted as bullet points:

• The company designs, develops, manufactures, sells, and leases high-performance fully electric vehicles and energy generation and storage systems.
• The automotive segment includes the design, development, manufacturing, sales, and leasing of high-performance fully electric vehicles, as well as sales of automotive regulatory credits.
• The energy generation and storage segment includes the design, manufacture, installation, sales, and leasing of solar energy generation and energy storage products and related services.
• TSLA currently manufactures five different consumer vehicles: Model 3, Y, S, X, and Cybertruck.
• The base price for mass-market appeal is $35,000 for the Model 3.
• In November 2023, TSLA entered the consumer pickup truck market with first deliveries of the Cybertruck.
• In 2022, TSLA began early production and deliveries of a commercial electric vehicle, the Tesla Semi.
• The company plans to address additional vehicle markets with future electric vehicles.
• Powerwall is a lithium-ion battery energy storage product designed for homes or small commercial facilities.
• Megapack is an energy storage solution for commercial, industrial, utility, and energy generation customers.

ITEM 1A. RISK FACTORS.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART I - ITEM 1A. RISK FACTORS section in bullet points:

• The company may experience delays in launching and ramping production of its products and features due to unanticipated supplier issues or manufacturing process challenges.
• TSLA has previously experienced launch and production ramp delays for new products, including the initial ramp of its Model X and certain manufacturing processes for Model 3 vehicles.
• The company's future business depends on increasing mass-market vehicle production, which requires efficient and cost-effective manufacturing capabilities, supply chains, and skilled employees.
• Bottlenecks and unexpected challenges may arise during production ramps, requiring prompt addressing to improve manufacturing processes and reduce costs.
• TSLA may experience delays in launching and/or ramping production of energy storage products, Solar Roof, new product versions or variants, vehicles, and future products due to design, construction, regulatory, or other approvals issues.
• The company's artificial intelligence services and products may face challenges related to energy availability, processing power limitations, and substantial data center power requirements.

ITEM 1C. CYBERSECURITY.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART I - ITEM 1C. CYBERSECURITY section of TSLA's cybersecurity risk management and strategy:

• Cybersecurity risks include operational risks, intellectual property theft, fraud, extortion, harm to employees or customers, and violation of data privacy or security laws.

• The company identifies and addresses cybersecurity risks through a multi-faceted approach, including third-party assessments, internal IT audits, IT security, governance, risk, and compliance reviews.

• Proactive measures are taken to defend, detect, and respond to cybersecurity incidents, such as proactive privacy and cybersecurity reviews of systems and applications, penetration testing, bug bounty programs, employee training, and monitoring emerging laws and regulations.

• The company has implemented incident response and breach management processes with four stages: preparation, detection and analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery.

• As of 2024, the Information Security Management System (ISMS) has been certified to conform to the requirements of ISO/IEC 27001:2013.

• The risk management program assesses third-party risks and performs third-party risk management to identify and mitigate risks from vendors, suppliers, and other business partners associated with third-party service providers.

ITEM 2. PROPERTIES.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART I - ITEM 2. PROPERTIES section in bullet points:

• TSLA is headquartered in Austin, Texas.
• The company has a large number of properties in North America, Europe, and Asia used for various purposes such as manufacturing, warehousing, engineering, retail, service locations, Supercharger sites, and administrative offices.
• The facilities are leased with the primary exception of some manufacturing facilities, which are owned by the company.
• The initial term of the land use rights is 50 years.
• The land use rights are treated as operating lease right-of-use assets.

ITEM 5. MARKET FOR REGISTRANT’S COMMON E.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from PART II - ITEM 5. MARKET FOR REGISTRANT’S COMMON EQUITY, RELATED STOCKHOLDER MATTERS AND ISSUER PURCHASES OF EQUITY SECURITIES in bullet points:

• Our common stock has traded on The NASDAQ Global Select Market under the symbol “TSLA” since June 29, 2010.

• As of January 22, 2025, there were 9,512 holders of record of our common stock.

• We have never declared or paid cash dividends on our common stock and do not anticipate paying any in the foreseeable future.

• The initial public offering was priced at approximately $1.13 per share on June 28, 2010, after adjustments for two stock splits (August 2022 and August 2020).

• A substantially greater number of holders of our common stock are "street name" or beneficial holders, held by banks, brokers, and other financial institutions.

• The performance graph shows a comparison of the cumulative total return on our common stock, The NASDAQ Composite Index, and a group of all public companies sharing the same SIC code as us (SIC code 3711) from January 1, 2020 through December 31, 2024.

• In May 2019, we sold warrants to several financial institutions, which were exercised between October 1, 2024 and October 15, 2024, resulting in the issuance of 2,894,424 shares of our common stock.

• We have not made any purchases of equity securities by the issuer or affiliated purchasers.

ITEM 7. MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANAL.summary:
Here are the key facts from the PART II - ITEM 7. MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS section in bullet points:

• In 2024, Tesla produced approximately 1,773,000 consumer vehicles and delivered approximately 1,789,000 consumer vehicles.
• The company recognized total revenues of $97.69 billion in 2024, representing an increase of $917 million compared to the prior year.
• Net income attributable to common stockholders was $7.09 billion in 2024, representing a decrease of $7.91 billion compared to the prior year.
• Tesla deployed 31.4 GWh of energy storage products in 2024.
• The company ended 2024 with $36.56 billion in cash and cash equivalents and investments, representing an increase of $7.47 billion from the end of 2023.
• Capital expenditures amounted to $11.34 billion in 2024 compared to $8.90 billion in 2023, representing an increase of $2.44 billion.

ITEM 7A. QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DI.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART II - ITEM 7A. QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DISCLOSURES ABOUT MARKET RISK in bullet points:

• TSLA transacts business globally in multiple currencies, resulting in foreign currency risks related to revenue, costs of revenue, and operating expenses denominated in currencies other than the U.S. dollar.
• The company is a net receiver of currencies other than the U.S. dollar for its foreign subsidiaries, affecting operating results as expressed in U.S. dollars.
• Fluctuations in exchange rates have resulted in gains (losses) on the settlement and re-measurement of monetary assets and liabilities denominated in currencies not equal to the local currency.
• Adverse changes in foreign currency exchange rates of 10% for all currencies could be experienced in the near-term, with a potential impact of $1.15 billion at December 31, 2024 and $1.01 billion at December 31, 2023.
• No foreign currency hedging was assumed in these calculations.

ITEM 8. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SUPPLEM.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART II - ITEM 8. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SUPPLEMENTARY DATA in bullet points:

• The consolidated financial statements for Tesla, Inc. and its subsidiaries as of December 31, 2024 and 2023 have been audited by an independent registered public accounting firm.
• The auditor's opinion is that the consolidated financial statements present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of the Company as of December 31, 2024 and 2023, and the results of its operations and cash flows for each of the three years ended December 31, 2024.
• The Company maintained effective internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2024.
• The auditor changed their opinion on the accounting principle related to digital assets in 2024 due to a change in the manner in which it is accounted for.
• The auditor conducted audits in accordance with the standards of the PCAOB and performed procedures to assess the risks of material misstatement of the consolidated financial statements.

agreement in 2020 with Travis County in.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from PART II - agreement in 2020 with Travis County in Texas, formatted as bullet points:

• We received grant funding equal to 100% of property taxes paid to Travis County.
• The grant funding was subject to meeting certain minimum economic development metrics through our construction and operations at Gigafactory Texas.
• A separate 10-year agreement was made with the Del Valle Independent School District in Texas, pursuant to which a portion of the taxable value of our property would be capped at a specified amount.

ITEM 9B. OTHER INFORMATION.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from PART II - ITEM 9B. OTHER INFORMATION in bullet points:

• On December 6, 2024, Ira Ehrenpreis adopted a Rule 10b5-1 trading arrangement for the potential exercise of options to purchase 761,961 shares of TSLA common stock.
• The subsequent sale of TSLA common stock subject to certain conditions will yield aggregate net proceeds to Mr. Ehrenpreis of $15 million after payment of commissions and fees.
• The expiration date of the trading arrangement is June 3, 2025.

ITEM 15. EXHIBITS AND FINANCIAL STATEMEN.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from PART IV - ITEM 15. EXHIBITS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENT SCHEDULES in bullet points:

• The company's financial statements are included in Part II, Item 8 of this report.
• All financial statement schedules have been omitted due to lack of applicability or insufficient amounts.
• Required information is included in the consolidated financial statements or accompanying notes.
• The following exhibits are filed or incorporated by reference as part of this report:
 + Furnished herewith (management contract or compensatory plan)
 + Confidential treatment requested for portions
 + Redacted portions in compliance with Regulation S-K Item 601(b)(10).
• A filing of SolarCity is listed under exhibit number (1).
• A filing of Maxwell Technologies, Inc. is listed under exhibit number (2).
